intro: Wahlenbergia cervicina, commonly known as the silverleaf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are silver-gray in color, giving it a distinctive appearance. Wahlenbergia cervicina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
